trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> software distribution provides two basic deployment options (also referred to as <term>frameworks</term>), the simple embedded option and the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server option.

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> software distribution provides two basic deployment options (also referred to as <term>frameworks</term>), the simple embedded option and the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server option.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> software distribution provides two basic deployment options (also referred to as <term>frameworks</term>), the simple embedded option and the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server option.

trans-unit.source: Refers to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> being started by a simple single-user Java application. With this option <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> runs in the same Java virtual machine (JVM) as the application. <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> can be almost invisible to the end user because it is started and stopped by the application and often requires no administration.

seg-source.mrk: Refers to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> being started by a simple single-user Java application.
With this option <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> runs in the same Java virtual machine (JVM) as the application.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> can be almost invisible to the end user because it is started and stopped by the application and often requires no administration.

target.mrk: Refers to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> being started by a simple single-user Java application.
With this option <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> runs in the same Java virtual machine (JVM) as the application.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> can be almost invisible to the end user because it is started and stopped by the application and often requires no administration.

trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> documentation often refers to this as the <term>embedded configuration</term> or <term>embedded mode</term>.

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> documentation often refers to this as the <term>embedded configuration</term> or <term>embedded mode</term>.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> documentation often refers to this as the <term>embedded configuration</term> or <term>embedded mode</term>.

trans-unit.source: Refers to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> being started by an application that provides multi-user connectivity to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases across a network. With this option <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> runs in the Java virtual machine (JVM) that hosts the Server. Applications connect to the Server from different JVMs to access the database. The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server is part of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> software distribution and provides this type of framework for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>. <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> also works well with other, independently developed Server applications.

seg-source.mrk: Refers to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> being started by an application that provides multi-user connectivity to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases across a network.
With this option <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> runs in the Java virtual machine (JVM) that hosts the Server.
Applications connect to the Server from different JVMs to access the database.

The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server is part of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> software distribution and provides this type of framework for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> also works well with other, independently developed Server applications.

target.mrk: Refers to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> being started by an application that provides multi-user connectivity to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases across a network.
With this option <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> runs in the Java virtual machine (JVM) that hosts the Server.
Applications connect to the Server from different JVMs to access the database.

The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server is part of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> software distribution and provides this type of framework for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> also works well with other, independently developed Server applications.

trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> documentation often refers to this as the <term>Network Server configuration</term> or <term>client/server configuration</term>.
